Class FSM_API.Interaction

Provides a set of methods for interacting with and managing FSM definitions and instances at runtime. This includes querying their existence, retrieving instances, ticking processing groups, and destroying definitions or individual instances.

Inheritance
object
FSM_API.Interaction

object.ToString()
Namespace: TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API
Assembly: FSM_API.dll
Syntax
public static class FSM_API.Interaction
Remarks

This static class groups all operations related to the lifecycle and real-time management of FSMs once they have been defined and instantiated. It serves as the primary interface for monitoring and controlling your FSMs after their initial setup.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

AddStateToFSM(string, string, Action<IStateContext>, Action<IStateContext>, Action<IStateContext>, string)

Dynamically adds a new state definition to an existing Finite State Machine blueprint at runtime.

Declaration
public static void AddStateToFSM(string fsmName, string stateName, Action<IStateContext> onEnter, Action<IStateContext> onUpdate, Action<IStateContext> onExit, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM blueprint to which the state will be added or updated.
string stateName

The name of the state to add or update. This must be unique within the FSM.
Action<IStateContext> onEnter

An Action<T> to execute when an FSM instance enters this state. Can be null.
Action<IStateContext> onUpdate

An Action<T> to execute when an FSM instance is in this state during an Update(string) call. Can be null.
Action<IStateContext> onExit

An Action<T> to execute when an FSM instance exits this state. Can be null.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Remarks

This method allows you to extend the behavior of an FSM after it has been defined. It internally uses an TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMModifier to apply the changes. If a state with the given stateName already exists in the FSM, its onEnter, onUpdate, and onExit actions will be updated. All active instances of this FSM definition will immediately reflect the added or updated state when they attempt to transition to or from it, or if they are currently in that state and its actions are modified.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName, stateName, or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found.
| Edit this page View Source

AddTransition(string, string, string, Func<IStateContext, bool>, string)

Dynamically adds a new transition between two states to an existing Finite State Machine blueprint.

Declaration
public static void AddTransition(string fsmName, string fromState, string toState, Func<IStateContext, bool> condition, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM blueprint to which the transition will be added or updated.
string fromState

The name of the state from which the transition originates. Use AnyStateIdentifier to define a transition that can occur from any state.
string toState

The name of the state to which the transition leads.
Func<IStateContext, bool> condition

A Func<T, TResult> that returns true when the transition should occur. This function operates on the IStateContext.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Remarks

This method internally uses an TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMModifier to apply the changes. This allows for changing the flow of your FSMs at runtime. If a transition from fromState to toState with the exact same condition already exists, it will be updated with the new condition.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName, fromState, toState, or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters, or if condition is null.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found.
InvalidOperationException

Thrown if fromState or toState does not exist within the FSM's defined states, unless fromState is AnyStateIdentifier.
| Edit this page View Source

DestroyFiniteStateMachine(string, string)

Removes a registered FSM definition and all its associated active instances from a specific processing group. This effectively unregisters the FSM blueprint and frees up resources for all its derived instances.

Declaration
public static void DestroyFiniteStateMachine(string fsmName, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The name of the FSM definition to destroy.
string processingGroup

The processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Remarks

This is a destructive operation for a specific FSM type. All current instances of this FSM definition will cease to be managed by the API. Their TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMHandle.DestroyHandle() method will be called to ensure proper OnExit logic is executed. Memory will then be eligible for garbage collection once all external references are released. If the FSM definition or group does not exist, a warning will be logged via InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception).

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
| Edit this page View Source

DestroyInstance(FSMHandle)

Unregisters a specific FSM instance from the system, allowing it to be garbage collected if no other references exist. This method searches across all active FSM definitions in all groups to find and deregister the instance.

Declaration
public static void DestroyInstance(FSMHandle instance)
Parameters
Type Name Description
FSMHandle instance

The FSMHandle of the specific live FSM instance to unregister.
Remarks

Use this method when a particular object managed by an FSM is no longer needed or is being destroyed (e.g., a game object being despawned), but its FSM definition might still be in use by other instances.

The instance's TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMHandle.DestroyHandle() method will be called to ensure any OnExit logic for its current state is executed before it is removed from management.

If the instance is not found (e.g., it was already unregistered or never registered), a warning will be logged via InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception).
Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentNullException

Thrown if the provided instance is null.
| Edit this page View Source

Exists(string, string)

Checks if an FSM definition with the given name exists within the specified processing group. This is useful for verifying if an FSM blueprint has been registered before attempting to create instances or modify its definition.

Declaration
public static bool Exists(string fsmName, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM definition to check for existence.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group to search within. Defaults to "Update".
Returns
Type Description
bool

true if the FSM definition exists in the specified group; otherwise, false.
Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.

The name of the processing group to query for FSM definitions. Defaults to "Update".
Returns
Type Description
IReadOnlyCollection<string>

A read-only collection of strings, where each string is the name of an FSM definition. If the processing group does not exist, an empty collection is returned.
Exceptions
Type Condition

Thrown if processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.

GetInstance(string, IStateContext, string)

Retrieves a live FSMHandle for a specific FSM instance.

Declaration
public static FSMHandle GetInstance(string testFsmName, IStateContext context, string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string testFsmName

The name of the FSM blueprint, e.g., "PlayerMovementFSM".
IStateContext context

The unique context object (e.g., your character controller or enemy AI object) that identifies a specific FSM instance.
string processingGroup

The name of the group that this FSM instance belongs to.
Returns
Type Description
FSMHandle

A valid FSMHandle if a matching instance is found; otherwise, null.
Remarks

This is the primary public method to access an existing, running FSM instance. It uses the provided FSM name, the unique context object associated with the instance, and its processing group to locate and return the correct handle. This allows you to check the FSM's current state or manually trigger a transition from outside of the FSM's own logic.

| Edit this page View Source

GetInstances(string, string)

Retrieves all active, live instances of a specific FSM definition within a given processing group.

Declaration
public static IReadOnlyList<FSMHandle> GetInstances(string fsmName, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The name of the FSM definition whose active instances you want to retrieve.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Returns
Type Description
IReadOnlyList<FSMHandle>

A read-only list of FSMHandle objects, each representing a live FSM instance derived from the specified definition.
Remarks

Each FSMHandle in the returned list represents a currently running Finite State Machine, bound to its own unique context object. This method allows you to inspect, manage, or interact with all live applications of a particular FSM blueprint.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found. Ensure the FSM has been defined prior to attempting to retrieve its instances.
| Edit this page View Source

RemoveProcessingGroup(string)

Removes an entire FSM processing group from the system, along with all FSM definitions and all their active instances associated with that group.

Declaration
public static void RemoveProcessingGroup(string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group to remove.
Remarks

This is a destructive operation. Use this method carefully, typically when an entire subsystem or module that relies on a specific FSM processing group is being unloaded or shut down. All memory and resources tied to FSMs in this group will be released and they will no longer be managed by the API. If the group does not exist, a warning will be logged via InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception).

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
| Edit this page View Source

RemoveStateFromFSM(string, string, string, string)

Dynamically removes a state definition from an existing Finite State Machine blueprint at runtime.

Declaration
public static void RemoveStateFromFSM(string fsmName, string stateName, string fallbackStateName, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM blueprint from which the state will be removed.
string stateName

The name of the state to remove.
string fallbackStateName

Optional: The name of the state to transition existing FSM instances to if they are currently in the state being removed. If not provided (null or empty), instances will default to transitioning to the FSM's InitialState.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Remarks

This method internally uses an TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMModifier to apply the changes.

When a state is removed, any active FSM instances currently in that state will be immediately transitioned. The transition target is determined as follows:

  • If a valid fallbackStateName is provided, instances will transition to that state.
  • If fallbackStateName is null, empty, or consists only of white-space, instances will instead transition to the FSM's InitialState.
The `OnExit` action of the removed state will be called, followed by the `OnEnter` action of the determined fallback or initial state.

If the specified state to remove does not exist in the FSM, a warning will be logged via InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception).

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName, stateName, or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found.
| Edit this page View Source

RemoveTransition(string, string, string, string)

Dynamically removes a specific transition between two states from an existing Finite State Machine blueprint.

Declaration
public static void RemoveTransition(string fsmName, string fromState, string toState, string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The unique name of the FSM blueprint from which the transition will be removed.
string fromState

The name of the state from which the transition originates. Use AnyStateIdentifier to remove a transition that occurs from any state.
string toState

The name of the state to which the transition leads.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM definition is registered. Defaults to "Update".
Remarks

This method internally uses an TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API.FSMModifier to apply the changes. This allows for removing unwanted or obsolete paths in your FSM's logic at runtime. If the specified transition does not exist, a warning will be logged via InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception).

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmName, fromState, toState, or processingGroup is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.
KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if the FSM definition specified by fsmName and processingGroup cannot be found.
| Edit this page View Source

Update(string)

Advances the FSM instance by one logical step. This involves executing the 'OnUpdate' action of the CurrentState and evaluating all defined transitions from the CurrentState. If a valid transition is found, the FSM will move to the next state, executing 'OnExit' for the old state and 'OnEnter' for the new state.

Declaration
public static void Update(string processingGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
string processingGroup

Optional: A string identifying the process group for error reporting, defaults to "Update".
Remarks

The Crucial Step for FSM Processing: This Update() method is fundamental to the operation of an FSM instance. Without it being called, the FSM will not execute its state's update logic, evaluate transitions, or progress through its defined states. An FSM definition, no matter how intricate, remains static until its instances are actively updated.

How FSMs are "Ticked": This method is primarily designed to be invoked by the FSM_API's internal management system (e.g., via FSM_API.Interaction.TickAll(string processingGroup)). The API manages the periodic invocation of this method for all registered FSM instances within a given processing group, respecting their defined ProcessRate.

CAUTION: Manual Invocation (Advanced Use Only): While publicly accessible, directly calling Update() manually from your application code should only be done by developers who possess a deep understanding of the FSM's internal processing cycle and lifecycle management. Manual invocation outside of the FSM_API's managed loop can lead to:

  • Unpredictable state behavior due to uncontrolled update rates.
  • Performance issues if not integrated into an efficient game loop or update scheduler.
  • Conflicts with the FSM_API's internal error handling and instance management.
Use with extreme care and only when building a highly customized, self-managed FSM update system.
